## Command line solution

1. Start RStudio or standalone R.
1. Use `setwd()` to set the current working directory to the main directory of the repository. This is done automatically when using an RStudio project.
1. Run the command `source("source/render-Rmd.R")`.

## GUI solution

### Setup

1. Install RStudio according to the guidelines.
1. Go to Github.com and copy the clone URL.
1. Open RStudio.
1. Use 'File' > 'New Project' > 'Version control' > 'Git'.
1. Copy the clone URL into the 'Repository URL' and create the project.

### Render all Rmd files

1. Open RStudio.
1. Open the project.
1. Open the 'render-Rmd.R' file.
1. Execute the script by pushing the 'Source' button.
